    Upstate New York First Day Hike Ideas

    Upstate New York First Day Hike Ideas

    What better way to celebrate the first day of 2019 than to take a hike? The New York State DEC, as well as some private organization, host hikes at parks and preserves around the state. Here are a few upstate New York hikes we found for all levels, in the Catskills, Adirondacks, and Capital Region.

    Hudson Valley/Catskills

    • Kelly Hollow: Sponsored by the Catskill Mountain Club
    • First Night Hike & Snowshoe: Catskill Interpretive Center
    • First Day Hike at Sam's Point: Snowshoe or hike at the Minnewaska State Preserve

    Adirondacks

    • Prospect Mountain: Hike to the top of this mountain overlooking the southern end of Lake George
    • Poke-O-Moonshine: Climb to the firetower atop this mountain overlooking Lake Champlain in the northern Adirondacks

    Capital Region

    • Five Rivers Environmental Education Center: Great event for family members of all ages exploring nature trails at this preserve just south of Albany
    • Saratoga Spa State Park: Explore the geysers and other beautiful natural features of this beautiful park and end with hot cocoa
    • Thacher Park: Experience the Helderbergs in southern Albany County on a hike through this park

    Check out one of my favorite Adirondack trail guides.
